leaves.text: click the channel selector drop down.
Apple need to take manual action on the account to enable 3 things before we can start publishing. Because of this, it's best to do this step straight after creating the channel.
They need to apply custom fonts to the channel (Baskerville)
They need to enable the analytics/reporting endpoint so that we can start polling it for data.
They need to approve the channel to get it out of test mode.
Here's an example of the last email I sent Apple requesting these things to be done:

Hey News Ops Team,

We’re planning on taking TC-CA and TC-CA-FR (French Canada) live.

TC-CA channel_id is:

We assume the following will need to also be done, if that could be done asap, that would be wonderful.

- apply custom fonts to the channels (attached is the fonts payload).
- enable the analytics endpoint for the channel so we don’t

.
- channel removed from the preliminary state (state which forces three draft articles to be published first).
Once accepted, you need to change the Role to
Sales is the role which gives access to Newspublisher analytics, but doesn't grant any further privileges.
You'll need to consult with the region to identify what sections they want to run on the channel. This is similar to section pages, but may not be a 100% 1-1 match.
Once the region has specified the sections they would like for apple news you can create them here:
Select the channel from the channel drop down.
We'll now need the API key to put into TC's
Select the channel from the channel drop down.
